data: GYN Pre Procedure / Enhanced Recovery After Surgery (ERAS) Pre Operative (Day of Surgery)
Refer to reference text for appropriate pathway for corresponding surgery
once, Notify anesthesiologist if result greater than 8 mmol/L on non-diabetic patient OR diabetic patient without Pre-operative Orders for Diabetic Patients-Elective Surgery
Have patient void immediately prior to surgery and document voiding time
Give 250 mL of clear juice (eg. apple) if more than 3 hours before scheduled surgery time
If greater than 60 years of age, consider lower infusion rate
order rate: 75 mL/h, IV, drug form: bag
order rate: 25 mL/h, IV, drug form: bag
order rate: 100 mL/h, IV, drug form: bag
order rate: 125 mL/h, IV, drug form: bag
5,000 unit, subcutaneous, pre-op, drug form: inj
Apply Below the Knee Sequential Compression Devices
To be initiated in the operating room

ceFAZolin can be safely administered to patients with penicillin allergy, including anaphylaxis. Do NOT administer if severe delayed skin reaction to any beta-lactam (e.g. drug reaction with eosinophilia and systemic symptoms, Stevens-Johnson syndrome, toxic epidermal necrolysis)
1,000 mg, IV, pre-op, drug form: bag

3,000 mg, IV, pre-op, drug form: bag
If ceFAZolin allergic or contraindicated, select clindamycin AND [tobramycin OR ciprofloxacin]. Use ciprofloxacin if significant renal dysfunction
5 mg/kg, IV, pre-op, drug form: inj
